intro: Dorstenia erecta var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf false banana, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and unique, spiral-shaped inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its compact size and attractive foliage. Dorstenia erecta var. minor prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it suitable for indoor cultivation.
